headline.medium: Molo sites are built to support multiple languages; if the site has more than one language then the language selection list appears

content.topic: Typically you’ll see anything from 2 to 5 languages, but it’s also not uncommon to see as much as 9 different languages.

unorderedList.text: The position of the language selection list is usually at the top of the page to allow foreign speakers  to rapidly identify and switch to a mother tongue. Once a user has selected a language they’ll always see the site in that language when they revisit. (Unless they’ve deleted their cookies, or are browsing in a private mode

The list of languages are visually separated with a detail, or whitespace. (we use a css property called “:after” to achieve this, so it requires some CSS support.) The active language (the language in use) should be displayed less prominently than the other languages.
